title: Starbucks to sell majority stake in China business
description: The coffee giant entered China more than a quarter of a century ago but has faced tough competition in recent years.
content:
Starbucks says it is selling a 60% stake in its business in China as part of a $4bn (£3.04bn) deal with investment firm Boyu Capital.
Under the agreement, the world's biggest coffee chain will have a 40% stake in the Chinese retail operation and reta... [1355 chars]

title: Reeves to lay groundwork for tax rises in ‘candid’ speech about budget
description: Chancellor to promise ‘fairness and opportunity’ but will not repeat manifesto pledge on tax, after PM’s hint at breach
content:
Rachel Reeves will lay the groundwork for a tax-raising budget that could break Labour’s election promise on income tax, in a major speech in which she will be “candid” about the tough choices ahead.
The chancellor will give the speech as the markets... [6526 chars]

title: Reeves says Budget will be 'fair' as tax rise speculation mounts
description: The Chancellor's speech is expected to roll the pitch for a difficult Budget.
content:
Chancellor Rachel Reeves says she will take "fair choices" in the Budget as economists continue to predict tax rises to try to balance the books.
Reeves is expected to give a speech to Downing Street later ahead of the 26 November Budget. Labour expl... [1945 chars]

title: Hundreds of victims of cancer-linked pregnancy drug call compared to Thalidomide call for public inquiry
description: Jennifer Bradley was told in 1970 that the DES drug prescribed during pregnancy was ‘completely safe’ - but it has left her daughter with lifelong gynaecological issues
content:
At aged 50, Susie Martin has already undergone her fair share of health procedures. She has endured dozens of surgeries - once going through five procedures in a single year - and will need to have screening for the rest of her life.
